response_requirements.initial_response_description: As soon as practicable and without delay - generally interpreted as within 10 business days for simple requests, though complex requests may require additional reasonable time
response_requirements.final_response_notes: No specific statutory deadline; must respond 'as soon as practicable and without delay'
response_requirements.extension_notes: Complex requests may require additional reasonable time; must notify requester of delays and provide estimate
response_requirements.good_faith_standard: As soon as practicable and without delay

fee_structure.search_fee: May charge if location cost exceeds $50
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge actual, necessary, and direct cost of location if cost exceeds $50; must provide written estimate
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Standard rates: typically $0.25 per page for photocopies; other formats at actual reproduction cost
fee_structure.fee_waiver_notes: Cannot charge for inspection; cannot require prepayment for inspection
fee_structure.reasonableness_standard: May not exceed actual, necessary, and direct cost of reproduction and transcription

exemptions.description: Authority shall not provide access to record containing personally identifiable information unless specifically authorized/required by statute or individual consents
Records designated confidential by statute; balancing test may permit access if public interest outweighs confidentiality interest
Drafts, notes, preliminary computations prepared for originator's personal use or personal property with no relation to office
Proprietary business information and trade secrets

appeal_process.first_level_notes: No administrative appeals - direct mandamus action in circuit court. Authority bears burden to prove record is exempt.
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Reasonable attorney fees, damages, and costs to requester if substantially prevails. Minimum $100 damages for arbitrary denials.
appeal_process.criminal_penalties_notes: Minimum $100 damages if court finds arbitrary and capricious denial; additional actual damages may be awarded

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No specific form required for requests; may be oral or written (written recommended); must adequately describe records sought
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Any requester has right to inspect any record except committed/incarcerated persons (unless requesting records about themselves/minor children)
requester_requirements.specific_format: No specific format required - oral or written

agency_obligations.records_officer_title: Officers or employees designated for records requests
agency_obligations.business_hours_notes: Must post notice describing organization, access times/places, methods, and responsible officers/employees
agency_obligations.electronic_submission_notes: Must create electronic record if information stored electronically and creation doesn't unduly burden authority
agency_obligations.response_format_options: If feasible, may permit immediate inspection; otherwise within reasonable period must make available or notify of denial
agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: If only part subject to disclosure, must delete confidential information and provide access to remainder
agency_obligations.liberal_interpretation: Construed with presumption of complete public access; denial contrary to public interest except in exceptional cases

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Wisconsin statutes. Response time: 'as soon as practicable and without delay' - generally 10 business days for simple requests (ground truth shows 60 business_days for complex requests). Presumption of complete public access. No administrative appeals - direct mandamus to circuit court. Attorney fees for substantially prevailing requesters. Minimum $100 damages for arbitrary denials. Cannot destroy records for 60 days after denial. Balancing test for confidential records.
unique_characteristics: No administrative appeals - direct mandamus action
Cannot destroy records for 60 days after denial
Must create electronic format if feasible
